item.title: IRC meeting summary for 2016-07-07
item.description:
IRC meeting summary for 2016-07-07

Gmaxwell notes he'd still like to see separate testnet-defaulting binaries during the RC's. Wumpus points at a PR he missed that makes it very easy to install a testnet client. 0.13.0 rc1 & HD wallet issue FIBRE announcement The Bitcoin Core team is working towards 0.13.0 RC1.

item.title: Belgium Regulators Issue Warning About OneCoin Investment Scheme - CoinDesk
item.description:
Belgium Regulators Issue Warning About OneCoin Investment Scheme - CoinDesk

A top financial regulator in Belgium has issued a warning about OneCoin, a digital currency product that has frequently drawn fraud accusations. The notice, published this weekend, states that remarks from promoters that OneCoin has received the institution's tacit approval are "false and misleading".

item.title: Beginner's Guide to Ethereum Mining - How to Mine Ethereum on Your PC?
item.description:
Beginner's Guide to Ethereum Mining - How to Mine Ethereum on Your PC?

If you're new to mining Ethereum, this guide covers all the important facts in a simple, low-jargon way. Let's start with some short answers to common questions about Ethereum mining: Q: Why should I mine Ethereum tokens (aka ether or ETH)? doesn't mining Ether take up a lot of electricity?

item.title: Bitcoin Beyond Nerds: How to Get the Average Joe to Use Cryptocurrency
item.description:
Bitcoin Beyond Nerds: How to Get the Average Joe to Use Cryptocurrency

Bitcoin is still seen as the tech nerd's plaything rather than the everyman's money. Four cryptocurrency adoption experts share their tips and tricks for how to bring crypto to the average Joe. A 2013 report found that the vast majority of Bitcoin users were male, libertarian, non-religious, and used their coins for donations rather than illegal activity.

item.title: Traders Getting High on HempCoin
item.description:
Traders Getting High on HempCoin

HempCoin is a Scrypt algorithm coin like Litecoin and countless other Bitcoin alternatives, but unlike most, it has a publicly traded company, Rocky Mountain Ayre, backing it. Interest seems to be increasing in the coin, which is one of the many currencies targeting marijuana dispensaries and other legal marijuana entities which have banking issues due to federal regulations in the United States.

item.title: Bitcoin Allows You to Buy 2016's Most Anticipated Game
item.description:
Bitcoin Allows You to Buy 2016's Most Anticipated Game

No Man's Sky - arguably 2016's most anticipated game, or at least a contender for the distinction - is seeing its developers accept bitcoin as a payment method to purchase the game, due to launch in August.

item.title: Why bitcoin is on the verge of a breakout: In one chart
item.description:
Why bitcoin is on the verge of a breakout: In one chart

By This year has been a strong period for bitcoin bulls, as the price of the digital currency has climbed to levels not seen in more than two years. Now, a technical trading pattern commonly used by equity analysts has emerged on the digital currency's chart-and it suggests that prices are poised to shoot even higher.

item.title: SEC Opens Winklevoss Bitcoin Trust Filing for Public Comment - CoinDesk
item.description:
SEC Opens Winklevoss Bitcoin Trust Filing for Public Comment - CoinDesk

Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss are another step closer to offering the first Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) regulated bitcoin investment product following a request for comment published Friday. Last month, BATS proposed a rule change that would result in the listing and trading of the Winklevoss Bitcoin Shares issued by the Winklevoss Bitcoin Trust.

item.title: Urbit: The Bold Pitch to Re-Decentralize the Internet, on Top of the Internet
item.description:
Urbit: The Bold Pitch to Re-Decentralize the Internet, on Top of the Internet

Urbit, the computing platform described as a "city in the cloud" by its inventors, raised more than $200,000 in four hours through a crowdsale last week. While the crypto-space has seen many spectacular crowd-sales, some more dodgy than others, Urbit has been able to excite leading venture capitalists and executives in the space, including BitGo's Ben Davenport, 21 Inc.'s Balaji Srinivasan and Chaincode Labs' Alex Morcos.
